place.name: MIDVILLE
place.gazetteerText: MIDVILLE, a parochial township in Spilsby district, Lincoln; near Old Leake r. station, and 7 miles S by W of Spilsby. Post town, Boston. Acres, 3,450. Real property, £4,154. Pop., 152. Houses, 29. The property is chiefly divided among five. The surface is part of the East Fen, was formerly marsh, and has been drained. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £81. Patrons, the Bishop of Lincoln and Trustees. The church is a plain brick building with a bell-turret. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
